Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words. Response: Good morning, everyone!

It’s a real pleasure to welcome you to Frisko Shipping. I founded this company back in 2001, and believe it or not, the idea came to me after a rather dramatic experience — I fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. But what truly changed my life wasn’t the shark — it was the passing ship that rescued me. That moment made me realize the incredible power of shipping to connect and save lives. And that’s when I knew I wanted to start my own company.

Fast forward to today: Frisko Shipping now operates in 20 cities around the world. We’re a team of over 5,000 people, and last year, we earned a profit of 5 million dollars, holding 10% of the global market. But numbers only tell part of the story. What really drives our success is the energy, creativity, and commitment of people like you.

We’ll kick things off with a short quiz to see how much you already know about the company — no pressure, just for fun!

As you begin your journey here, I encourage you to stay curious, stay motivated, and look for inspiration everywhere. If I found mine in the middle of the ocean, you never know where yours might come from.

Welcome aboard!
text_b: Good morning, everyone! It’s a real pleasure to welcome you to Frisko Shipping. I founded this company back in 2001, and believe it or not, the idea came to me after a rather dramatic experience — I fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. But what truly changed my life wasn’t the shark — it was the passing ship that rescued me. That moment made me realize the incredible power of shipping to connect and save lives. And that’s when I knew I wanted to start my own company. Fast forward to today: Frisko Shipping now operates in 20 cities around the world. We’re a team of over 5,000 people, and last year, we earned a profit of 5 million dollars, holding 10% of the global market. But numbers only tell part of the story. What really drives our success is the energy, creativity, and commitment of people like you. We’ll kick things off with a short quiz to see how much you already know about the company — no pressure, just for fun! As you begin your journey here, I encourage you to stay curious, stay motivated, and look for inspiration everywhere. If I found mine in the middle of the ocean, you never know where yours might come from. Welcome aboard!

text_b: The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong has shown a significant upward trend over the past six months, primarily driven by investment from Mainland China. This growth has been particularly noticeable in the Properties and Utilities Sub-indices, which have experienced dramatic increases due to the strong financial backing and economic expansion from China. Six months ago, the HSI had dipped to a low of 20,956, reflecting concerns about market conditions and external factors. However, the index has since rebounded, climbing to a high of 27,499, highlighting the resilience of Hong Kong’s stock market and its recovery momentum. Experts are optimistic about the future performance of the HSI, with projections indicating further growth in the coming year. This optimism is largely fueled by continued large-scale investments from other countries, coupled with the internal demand within Hong Kong. The robust economic activity, both locally and internationally, is expected to support further gains in the Hang Seng Index, positioning it for sustained growth in the year ahead.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: nan
text_b: I live in India, Mohali, Punjab. Buying at home at my place is not that a big process thing and you may or may not involve a real estate agent. It depends how the property is in the market, whether through through the broker or directly by the owner. Prices in my city is also kind of high as compared to the average prices in tier 2 cities reason its a wellplanned city and quality of life is also good. Now coming to the loan part, there are multiple options. One is obviously the banksand other is NBFC. Banks are usually preferred by persons having good credit score and consistent incomeand offer home loans at a lower rate as compared to NBFC. NBFC comes into picture where credit score or income is not good and thus higher risk for the lending institution. Sothey cater specifically to those people who does not have kind of good documentation and charge a higher rate of interest due to increased risk. There are standard forms and documents to be filled out. Documents primarily are ID proof, address proof, Income proofand property documents. You need not hire a mortgage broker. The rate of interest varies based on cost of property, loan amountand credit scoreranging between 8.25% to 12% per annum. The process is easy provided all the documents are provided timely and all are good like loantovalue ratio, incometoobligation ratio. If all are in place, we can expect to get funds within 10-15 days. Bank also tends to process faster if the deal value is big or you are a oldvaluable customer.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: NAFTA stays for “North American Free Trade Agreement”. To be more specific, it is a trade agreement between the states of North America, therefore US, Canada and Mexico.

It took years to negotiate the its terms and conditions, but, at the end, the concerned countries reached an agreement, which came into force in January 1994.  

The purpose of this agreement is to reduce or eliminate customs duties among the members. To put in another way, it has had a profound effect on trade relations, especially in agriculture. For example, Mexican fruits and vegetables flow into the US. This is important for the growth of Mexican economy as well as for American economy too. In fact, notoriously, USA have low production of vegetable and fruits. 

Therefore, the agreement produces both positive and negative impacts on members: free trade policy, reduction of customs duties and tariffs, but also negative effect for domestic industries. 

To summarise, all three members have benefits from this commercial agreement.
text_b: NAFTA stays for “North American Free Trade Agreement”. To be more specific, it is a trade agreement between the states of North America, therefore US, Canadaand Mexico. It took years to negotiate the its terms and conditions, but, at the end, the concerned countries reached an agreement, which came into force in January 1994. The purpose of this agreement is to reduce or eliminate customs duties among the members. To put in another way, it has had a profound effect on trade relations, especially in agriculture. For example, Mexican fruits and vegetables flow into the US. This is important for the growth of Mexican economy as well as for American economy too. In fact, notoriously, USA have low production of vegetable and fruits. Therefore, the agreement produces both positive and negative impacts on members: free trade policy, reduction of customs duties and tariffs, but also negative effect for domestic industries. To summarise, all three members have benefits from this commercial agreement.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: The Nagin is a legendary shape-shifting serpent from Indian mythology. These beings can transform between human and serpent formsoften depicted as large, majestic snakes with shimmering scales or as humans with subtle serpentine features like slit-like eyes. In serpent formNagin are grand and awe-inspiring. In human form, they may retain some snake-like traits. They can shape-shift at will, possess immense strength, wisdom, and magical powers. Nagin are believed to dwell in opulent underground palaces near water bodies such as rivers, lakes, and seas. They are also linked to the underworld and are seen as guardians of hidden treasures. Revered in Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain traditions, Nagins are protectors of water sources and are invoked in rituals for rain and fertility. However, they can be vengeful if their own peers are hurt. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible. Response: Hang Seng Index (HSI) Report

Over the past six months, the Hang Seng Index (HSI) has exhibited steady growth, largely fueled by investments from Mainland China. This significant influx of capital has enhanced investor confidence, propelling the index to achieve the 30,000-point mark. Nevertheless, it is crucial to remain vigilant, as the market may experience profit-taking activities, which could potentially lead to a deceleration.

Both properties and sub-indices have mirrored the growth of the HSI, and experts predict that this positive trend will persist into the following year, bolstered by robust internal demand in Hong Kong.

In comparison to other indices, such as the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the HSI has shown greater volatility. Therefore, it is advisable for investors to exercise patience and be mindful of potential market fluctuations.

Overall, while the outlook remains positive, a cautious approach is recommended to navigate the potential risks and capitalize on the ongoing growth.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: nan
text_b: Flight Report On June 13, 2010, at 1818 Pacific Daylight Time, InterStar Airways Flight 293, landed at San Francisco International Airport (SFO), San Francisco, California, with the nose wheels cocked at 90 degrees. InterStar Airways was operating the airplane as a scheduled domestic passenger flight. The captain, first officer, four flight attendants, and 141 passengers were not injured. The flight departed Oakland, California, at 1531 as a non-stop to Sky Harbor International Airport, Phoenix, Arizona. The captain noted no problems during the initial departure, and observed a positive rate of climb. The flight crew noted an error message displayed on the control board. There was a fault message for a nose landing gear shock absorber. The data indicated that the gear handle was positioned to the down position, and there was an error message of a fault for the nose wheel steering. The flight diverted to San Jose, California. The captain was asked to perform a flyby of the tower for verification on the gear status. The tower, InterStar ground personnel, and a local news helicopter advised him that the nose gear was cocked 90 degrees to the left. When he found out this information, the captain decided to divert to SFO because it had optimum field conditions, a longer runway, and a better emergency support services. The crew flew for several hours to burn fuel so that they could land at a lighter weight. The captain advised the cabin crew that in the event that the nose gear collapsed, evacuation from the front doors was not available so everyone would deplane from the rear exits. The flight crew continually updated the cabin crew and passengers about the situation, and advised the cabin crew to prepare for emergency procedures. The captain flew the airplane for the landing. He touched down at 120 knots, and applied normal braking at 90 knots. He held the nose gear off of the ground as long as possible. At 60 knots, the flight crew shut down the engines. They did not use reverse thrust or auto-braking. During the landing, the forward cabin crew could smell burnt rubber. The air traffic control tower confirmed that there was no fire, and the captain announced this to the cabin crew. After this notification, the passengers deplaned normally using an air stair. Upon touchdown, the tires rapidly deflated and tore apart, and both wheels were worn into the axle. During landing, the airplane's trajectory was not affected by the abnormal configuration or subsequent tire destruction, and the airplane stayed on the runway centerline.

text_b: Focus groups: Focus groups can be influenced by dominant participants, which may lead to biased responses or discourage quieter individuals from contributing. They can also be expensive and time-consuming to organize, especially if participants need to be recruited and compensated. Additionally, the data is qualitatiev, making it harder to generalize or quantify, Surveys: Surveys often suffer from low response rates, which can skew the results. Questions may be misunderstood by participants, leading to inaccurate date. They also lack the depth of qualitative methods and can miss the reasons behind responses, Designing effective surveys requires careful wording and structure. Interviews; Interviews are time. consuming and resource-intesive, especially if conducted one-on-one. The presence of an interviewer may introduce bias or influence how participants respond. Analyzing interview data is also labor-intensive, perticularly when looking for patterns in open-ended responses.

Convergence between computing and telecommunications has finally taken hold, enabled by the internet as the emerging backbone for a global network economy. Ongoing research by my company reveals that since the mid-1980s, most large mergers and acquisitions — deals worth more than 500 million dollars — have resulted in poor returns to shareholders over the following three years, relative to industry averages. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Of the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor and loop writing stand out to me as particularly useful. Metaphors allow for a more vivid and creative way to express ideas, making abstract concepts more tangible and engaging. They can transform a simple description into something more thought-provoking, which I find helpful in sparking deeper connections and insights in my writing. For example, describing a difficult situation as "walking through a storm" can instantly convey both the struggle and the resilience needed to overcome it.

On the other hand, loop writing offers a way to overcome writer’s block and refine ideas. The process of looping—where you write and then come back to expand on or refine what you've written—allows for organic development of thoughts and ensures that I don't feel stuck in one place. This technique helps me explore different angles of a topic, adding layers to my writing without the pressure of crafting a perfect first draft. Both techniques provide flexibility and depth, which are crucial for expressing complex thoughts clearly and creatively.

Response: The Yali, also known as Vyala, is a popular Indian mythological creature often depicted as a guardian figure. It's a hybrid beast, typically portrayed with the head and body of a lion, the trunk and tusks of an elephant, and sometimes even equine features. Yalis are frequently featured in Hindu temples, often sculpted on pillars or placed at entrances to protect the sacred spaces.
Here's a more detailed description:
Appearance:Yalis are characterized by their mixed features. They commonly have the powerful body and head of a lion, the large trunk and tusks of an elephant, and sometimes, they may also bear elements of a horse. This combination of animals suggests a creature of strength, wisdom, and protection.
Role:Yalis are considered guardian creatures, protecting both physically and spiritually. Their presence in temples and on pillars is believed to ward off evil spirits and ensure the safety of those within.
Symbolism:The Yali's mixed features are symbolic. The lion represents power and courage, the elephant symbolizes wisdom and compassion, and the horse (when present) may represent speed and agility. This combination makes the Yali a versatile protector, capable of facing a wide range of threats.
Cultural Significance:Yalis are a prominent motif in Indian art and architecture, particularly in South India. They are a reminder of the importance of protection and the need to safeguard sacred spaces and individuals.

She was visiting an art gallery in the city, an experience she had been looking forward to for weeks. As she wandered through the exhibit, admiring a modern painting that seemed to change colors in the light, she felt a tap on her shoulder. Turning around, she was surprised to find no one there. Thinking it was just someone passing by, she turned back to the artwork, but then… it happened again. Another tap, this time a little more deliberate. She spun around, but still no one was in sight. text_b: Developing leadership qualities requires a blend of self-awareness, continuous learning, and intentional practice. From personal observations and experiences, great leaders often share key traits: empathy, communication, adaptability, and integrity. Empathy is foundational—it helps leaders understand and connect with others on a deeper level, fostering trust and collaboration. Communication is equally important, as clear, concise, and inspiring messages can guide a team toward shared goals. Adaptability allows leaders to navigate challenges and embrace change, while integrity ensures their actions align with their values, earning respect and loyalty. Leadership often begins with self-leadership: setting personal goals, managing time effectively, and cultivating discipline. Feedback from mentors or peers can also highlight areas for growth. I’ve seen people who were once quiet and hesitant transform into confident leaders after committing to self-improvement and stepping into challenging roles. I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader, but leadership takes different forms. Not all leaders are charismatic or outspoken; some lead quietly by example or excel in specific contexts. The key lies in recognizing one’s strengths, understanding others, and committing to growth. Leadership isn’t a title—it’s a mindset and a choice to influence positively.

text_b: The Kitsune is a legendary creature from Japanese folklore, renowned for its mystical and enigmatic nature. Often depicted as a fox, the Kitsune possesses the extraordinary ability to shape-shift into a human form, usually that of a beautiful woman. These magical foxes are believed to be highly intelligent and possess long lifespans, gaining a new tail for every hundred years they live, up to a maximum of nine tails. With each additional tail, their power and wisdom increase. Kitsune are known for their cunning and trickery, delighting in playing pranks on humans. However, they can also be benevolent, offering guidance and protection to those they favor. In some stories, they serve as faithful guardians of the Inari deity, the Shinto god of rice, fertility, and prosperity. The dual nature of the Kitsune, embodying both mischief and benevolence, makes them a fascinating and enduring figure in Japanese culture. The allure of the Kitsune lies in its mystery, its blend of beauty and danger, and its representation of the fine line between the human and the supernatural.

The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong has grown steadily over the past six months, thanks to investment from Mainland China. The Properties and Utilities Sub-indices have seen significant rises due to this growth.

The logistics industry involves the planning, implementation, and management of the movement and storage of goods, services, and information from the point of origin to the point of consumption. It includes transportation, warehousing, inventory management, packaging, and distribution. Efficient logistics ensures that products reach customers on time and in good condition, which is vital for businesses to stay competitive. The industry relies heavily on technology such as tracking systems, automation, and data analytics to optimize routes and reduce costs. With globalization and the rise of e-commerce, logistics has become increasingly complex and important, requiring skilled professionals to manage supply chains effectively.

text_a: Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>Challenges in Language Learning
 
Learning a new language is an exciting yet challenging journey. Many students face difficulties that make the process frustrating at times. One major challenge is pronunciation. Some sounds in a new language may not exist in a learner’s native tongue, making them hard to produce correctly. This can lead to misunderstandings in conversations.
 
Another issue is vocabulary retention. Memorizing new words is not enough; learners need to use them regularly to truly remember them. Without practice, words are easily forgotten. Similarly, grammar rules can be overwhelming. Every language has its own structure, and making mistakes is common. Some learners feel discouraged when they struggle to form correct sentences.
 
Confidence and fear of making mistakes also hold many students back. Speaking in a new language can be intimidating, especially in front of native speakers. The fear of being judged often prevents learners from practicing, which slows down progress.
 
Lastly, consistency is key, but many students struggle to stay motivated. Without regular practice, improvement is slow. Finding engaging ways to learn—such as watching movies, speaking with native speakers, or using language apps—can make the process more enjoyable.
 
Despite these challenges, persistence and practice lead to success. Every mistake is part of the learning journey, and with time, confidence grows.</input>

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write a summary of no more than 50-60 words about the case. Use the words below. This is a non-graded activity. Response: nan
text_b: The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating. In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case. During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Babi Ngepet or Boar demon is one of the famous urban legends in Indonesia especially in Java and Bali regions. The Local people know that Babi ngepet is a human who transforms himself into a boar and steal the money at night. An expert believe this urban legend emerged for the first time in 1830-1870 or during Dutch Colonialism in Indonesia. At that time, local Indonesian farmers were forced by the Dutch government to plant some valuable spices like peppers, ginger, tobacco etc (known as Cultuurstelsel). Those spices were exported to European countries. The practice of Cultuurstelsel created a suddenly rich local people especially the traders. The local farmers were suspicious that the traders used a black magic to get a lot of money (that’s a Babi ngepet) and became a very wealthy person.

This urban legend is believed & still popular among local people until now. In 2021, people who lived near the capital city were surprised by the emerge of black boar that was roaming at the street and captured by CCTV at night. At the same time, there was a man, who lived near the location, claimed that he lost a lot of money. The news and the video were then viral in Social Media. Police investigated the case and revealed that the man who lost the money was actually spread the hoax news to Social media to get attention from the people. The motif to commit this crime was because he was jealous with his neighbor that looked so wealthy, but rarely went outside for work.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: One legendary creature that has captivated the imagination of many in my country is the Wendigo. Rooted in Indigenous folklore, particularly in the northern regions, the Wendigo is a terrifying, malevolent spirit often associated with winter, famine, and greed. Described as a tall, emaciated figure with glowing eyes, the Wendigo is said to have a hunger that cannot be satisfied, driven by an insatiable craving for human flesh. What makes the Wendigo even more unsettling is the belief that those who fall victim to its curse transform into Wendigos themselves, driven to commit horrific acts of cannibalism. The creature’s power is amplified by the cold, desolate environments in which it is said to roam. As the legend goes, the more a person gives in to greed or self-interest, the more likely they are to invite the spirit into their soul, forever binding them to its endless hunger. The Wendigo continues to be a source of fear and fascination, often appearing in stories, movies, and folklore, embodying the dark side of human nature and the consequences of unchecked desire.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: **Challenges Faced by Language Learners**

Learning a new language is an exciting but often difficult journey. Many students face common challenges that can slow their progress. One major issue is pronunciation. How can students sound more like native speakers? It often takes a lot of listening and practice to pronounce words correctly. Another problem is vocabulary retention. How can learners remember so many new words? Without regular review and use in real-life situations, words are easy to forget.

Grammar is another obstacle. Many languages have complex grammar rules that differ from a student’s native language. For example, word order or verb conjugation might be confusing. Students may ask themselves: How do I know which grammar rule to use? Mistakes are common, and that can lead to frustration.

Confidence is also a big challenge. Why do some students hesitate to speak? Fear of making mistakes or being judged can prevent learners from practicing out loud. Finally, finding time and motivation is not easy. How can students stay consistent in their learning? Without strong habits, it’s easy to lose focus.

In conclusion, language learning involves many challenges—pronunciation, vocabulary, grammar, confidence, and motivation. However, with patience, regular practice, and a positive attitude, these difficulties can be overcome. Asking guiding questions can help students reflect on their weaknesses and improve step by step.
text_b: **Challenges Faced by Language Learners** Learning a new language is an exciting but often difficult journey. Many students face common challenges that can slow their progress. One major issue is pronunciation. How can students sound more like native speakers? It often takes a lot of listening and practice to pronounce words correctly. Another problem is vocabulary retention. How can learners remember so many new words? Without regular review and use in real-life situations, words are easy to forget. Grammar is another obstacle. Many languages have complex grammar rules that differ from a student’s native language. For example, word order or verb conjugation might be confusing. Students may ask themselves: How do I know which grammar rule to use? Mistakes are common, and that can lead to frustration. Confidence is also a big challenge. Why do some students hesitate to speak? Fear of making mistakes or being judged can prevent learners from practicing out loud. Finally, finding time and motivation is not easy. How can students stay consistent in their learning? Without strong habits, it’s easy to lose focus. In conclusion, language learning involves many challenges—pronunciation, vocabulary, grammar, confidence, and motivation. However, with patience, regular practice, and a positive attitude, these difficulties can be overcome. Asking guiding questions can help students reflect on their weaknesses and improve step by step.

text_b: One legendary creature that fascinates me is the Jorogumo, a mythical being from Japanese folklore. Often referred to as the "Spider Woman," the Jorogumo is said to be a shape-shifting creature that can transform from a giant spider into a beautiful woman. In her spider form, she is known to spin elaborate webs in remote areas, luring unsuspecting travelers into her traps. Once a victim is ensnared, she either devours them or uses their life force to maintain her youth and beauty. The Jorogumo is often portrayed as both seductive and deadly, embodying the dangers of both the natural world and human desires. Legends describe her as haunting mountain paths or the edges of rivers, waiting for the right moment to strike. In some versions of the myth, she also possesses the ability to manipulate the elements, especially water, further adding to her terrifying nature. Her story is a powerful reminder of the duality between beauty and danger, and she remains a captivating figure in Japanese literature, films, and art, embodying both the allure and peril of the unknown.

text_a: Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>Mumbai and New York City are two bustling metropolises that captivate with their unique charm and energy. Both cities are major financial hubs, with Mumbai being the heart of India’s economy and New York the epicenter of global finance. Skyscrapers dominate their skylines, showcasing architectural marvels such as the Empire State Building and the Bandra-Worli Sea Link.

Despite these similarities, the cultural landscapes of the two cities differ markedly. Mumbai is a melting pot of diverse cultures and languages, where traditional Indian festivals like Diwali and Ganesh Chaturthi are celebrated with fervor. In contrast, New York is a mosaic of global cultures, offering a cosmopolitan vibe where events like the Thanksgiving Parade and New Year’s Eve in Times Square draw people from around the world.

Transportation, too, sets them apart. Mumbai’s local trains are the city’s lifeline, bustling with commuters, while New York’s extensive subway system is famed for its connectivity. The culinary experiences in both cities are unparalleled, yet distinct. Mumbai offers street foods like vada pav and pani puri, while New York is renowned for its bagels and diverse international cuisines.

In essence, while Mumbai and New York share urban vibrancy and economic significance, their cultural essence and daily life offer contrasting experiences that make each city uniquely captivating.</input>

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Criticizing celebrities or the concept of celebrity culture can be a delicate task. Here’s a general critique of the idea of celebrity:

The phenomenon of celebrity culture often glorifies individuals for superficial reasons, such as their appearance or social media presence, rather than their genuine contributions to society. This can lead to a distorted sense of values, where fame and wealth are prioritized over integrity and hard work. Celebrities are frequently placed on pedestals, creating unrealistic standards that can negatively impact the self-esteem of their followers. Moreover, the constant scrutiny and invasion of privacy that celebrities endure can be detrimental to their mental health, highlighting the toxic nature of fame. The media’s obsession with celebrities also diverts attention from more pressing global issues, such as climate change and social justice, which deserve greater focus and action. In essence, while the allure of celebrity can be captivating, it often promotes a culture that is shallow and disconnected from the realities and challenges faced by everyday people.

Response: One legendary creatures from India that continues to fascinate me is the Makara. Often depicted as a half-land, half-aquatic beast, the Makara is a powerful symbol in Hindu and Buddhist mythology. It is said to be the vahana (vehicle) of Ganga, the river goddess, and also guards temple gateways as a protector from evil.
What makes the Makara truly captivating is its hybrid-form - it often combines the body of a crocodile with the trunk of an elephant, the tail of a fish an the jaws of a shark. Depending on regional interpretations, it can also have features of a stag, lion, or peacock, creating a majestic, almost dreamlike creature that defines natural classification.
It embodies both ferocity and grace- a creature of the depths yet revered as devine. More than just a myth, the Makara represents transformation and the unknown, reminding us that even in chaos, beauty and protection can co-exist.

text_a: Prompt Level: 12.0 Prompt: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: nan
text_b: Developing leadership qualities is a continuous journey of self-awareness and refinement. The most effective leaders I’ve observed cultivate a balance between confidence and humility—asserting their vision while remaining open to learning. Emotional intelligence plays a crucial role; leaders who genuinely understand and connect with others foster trust and inspire action. Resilience is another key trait. Every leader faces setbacks, but the ability to adapt, learn, and push forward defines their strength. Clear communication, strategic thinking, and decisiveness empower leaders to navigate complexities while guiding others effectively. While not everyone is naturally inclined toward leadership, I believe its core qualities—like integrity, empathy, and vision—can be cultivated. Leadership isn't just about taking charge; it’s about influence, responsibility, and inspiring growth in others. Some may lead in boardrooms, others in communities, or even in quiet, everyday moments of impact. Ultimately, leadership is less about a title and more about action—how consistently one upholds values, listens, and creates meaningful change. Anyone willing to develop these traits has the potential to lead, even if they never wear the label of "leader."

Response: One of the most captivating legendary creatures in the folklore of North America is the Sasquatch, often referred to as Bigfoot. This enigmatic being is said to inhabit the dense, shadowy forests of the Pacific Northwest, although tales of its presence have emerged from various regions across the continent. Described as a towering, bipedal ape-like entity, Sasquatch is characterized by its immense size, often reaching heights of six to ten feet, and its elusive nature.

The creature's physique is typically depicted as robust and covered in dark, shaggy hair, with large feet that leave distinctive footprints, which have become a focal point for cryptid enthusiasts and researchers alike. Despite the lack of definitive scientific evidence, the legend of Sasquatch persists, fueled by numerous accounts and alleged sightings that have been reported over the years.

Sasquatch embodies the mystery and wonder of the natural world, serving as a symbol of the unexplored and the unknown. Its enduring allure lies in its ability to straddle the line between myth and reality, inviting us to ponder the secrets that may still lie hidden within the wilderness. Whether regarded as a mere folklore or a potential undiscovered species, Sasquatch continues to captivate the imagination of many, inspiring both skepticism and belief.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Recommendation Report: Selection of Training Company

Introduction
This report evaluates two training companies, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, to recommend the most suit-able option for our organization.

Evaluation of TrainQuick
TrainQuick offers training programs that are both cost-effective and flexible. However, it has been observed that employees from our other branch are not utilizing these programs. Additionally, there is a general dissatisfaction among employees when they are mixed with participants from other branch-es during training sessions.

Evaluation of Skills Pro
Skills Pro, while more expensive, has received positive feedback regarding the quality of its course content. Although some employees have found the courses challenging, the majority of participants successfully complete the training. Furthermore, Skills Pro has plans to expand its course offerings, which could provide additional value to our organization.

Recommendation
Despite the higher cost, it is recommended to select Skills Pro as our training provider. The emphasis on quality and the high success rate of course completion indicate that Skills Pro will better meet our training needs and contribute to the professional development of our employees.

Conclusion
Investing in Skills Pro will ensure that our employees receive high-quality training, leading to improved performance and satisfaction. Quality training is essential for our organization's growth and success.

<input>Leadership qualities can be developed through practice, self-awareness, and learning from others. From my own experience, one of the most important leadership traits is effective communication. For example, when I was assigned to lead a group project, I learned that clearly expressing ideas and listening to my team’s input helped us work better together. Another key quality is empathy. Leaders who understand and care about others’ perspectives build trust and create a positive environment.

I’ve also observed that confidence and decisiveness play a big role in leadership. A good leader isn’t afraid to make decisions, even in challenging situations, and they inspire confidence in others. For instance, I once saw a peer confidently take charge during a school event when things weren’t going as planned, and their calm approach motivated everyone to adapt quickly.

I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader because leadership isn’t just about having authority—it’s about influencing and guiding others in positive ways. By working on skills like communication, adaptability, and empathy, anyone can grow into a leader in their own way.</input>

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The idea of celebrity in modern society is deeply problematic, and certain celebrities embody the negative aspects of this culture. Take, for example, influencers who promote an unrealistic lifestyle on social media. Many of them thrive on attention and materialism, presenting an image of perfection that is far from attainable for most people. This portrayal can be damaging, especially to young, impressionable audiences who compare their own lives to these curated, idealized versions of reality. Moreover, some celebrities use their fame to push products or ideologies without regard for the potential harm they may cause. They often endorse harmful beauty standards, promote unhealthy products, or spread misinformation. The excessive adoration these celebrities receive fosters a culture where fame and wealth are seen as the ultimate goals, overshadowing important values such as integrity, hard work, and compassion. Instead of being role models, many celebrities contribute to a shallow, consumer-driven culture that prioritizes appearance and status over substance. Society needs to rethink the way we view celebrities and reconsider whether they truly deserve the immense influence they hold.

Thank you for your trust in us.

Kind regards,
Monika

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Custom instruction:
Based on the notes, prepare one or two points each for the Method, Findings, Conclusions and Recommendations parts of the summary report. Write 100–175 words. Response: Report on Collarless Dress Shirt Survey Results

Dear Mr. Samson,
I am pleased to present the results of the surveys conducted in Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai regarding the collarless dress shirt. The survey aimed to gauge consumer opinions across various demographics in both cities.
Survey Methodology:
A sample of 1000 individuals was interviewed in each city. The primary objective was to assess the public’s reception of the collarless dress shirt, with a focus on their approval, purchase intent, and specific preferences or concerns.
Results:
Rio de Janeiro (1000 Participants):
•	Approval Rate: 35% 
o	Would Buy: 20%
•	Disapproval Rate: 65%
Shanghai (1000 Participants):
•	Approval Rate: 80% 
o	Would Buy: 40%
•	Disapproval Rate: 20%
For the 65% of participants in Rio who did not approve, the key reasons were:
•	Design Issues
•	Size Concerns
•	Color Preferences
•	Material Quality
For the 20% of participants in Shanghai who did not approve, the reasons were similar.

For the 20% in Rio and the 40% in Shangai who would purchase the collarless dress shirt, their satisfaction was moderate. The main points of dissatisfaction included:
•	Insufficient Market Research
•	Good Idea, Poor Execution
•	Lack of Diversity in Design

Recommendations:
Based on the survey feedback, we recommend the following actions to improve the collarless dress shirt's appeal:
1.	Increased Research: More comprehensive market research on men's needs in an accessory
2.	Improved Design: Focus on finer details, such as stitching color
3.	Size Options: Offer a slim fit to reach a more specific market segment.
4.	Color Palette: Opt for  primary colors like black and white.
5.	Material Improvements: Use wrinkle-free or sweat-absorbent fabrics to enhance comfort and usability.

The results in Rio de Janeiro show a significant gap in consumer approval, suggesting that changes to the product should be prioritized for the Brazilian market. On the other hand, Shanghai's results are more positive, but improvements could further increase satisfaction.

If you have any further questions or need additional information, please don’t hesitate to contact me.

Best regards,
James Tufnell
Head of Research

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write a summary of the logistics industry, similar to the one in the previous activity. Compare your text with the model.  Response: Summary – The Logistics Industry

The logistics industry is responsible for the transportation, storage, and delivery of goods. It plays a key role in connecting producers with consumers, both locally and internationally. Companies in this sector manage the movement of products by land, sea, and air to ensure timely and efficient delivery.

In recent years, technology has transformed the industry through tracking systems, automation, and data analysis, which help improve speed and reduce costs. E-commerce growth has also increased demand for fast and flexible delivery services.

However, the industry faces challenges such as rising fuel costs, environmental concerns, and the need for skilled labor. Companies are now investing in eco-friendly solutions and digital tools to remain competitive.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>Termination of Employment

7.1. Termination by Party A:

After the completion of the probationary period specified in paragraph 4, Party A may terminate the employment of Party B under the following conditions, ensuring strict compliance with anti-discrimination laws and practices:

(a) For Just Cause: Party A may terminate employment for just cause, which includes but is not limited to misconduct, neglect of duty, or breach of contract. Such termination must not be influenced by any form of discrimination based on race, gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. In cases of termination for just cause, Party B is not entitled to advance notice or compensation in lieu of notice.

(b) Without Just Cause: Party A may terminate employment without just cause, provided that the decision is free from discriminatory motives related to protected characteristics. In such cases, Party A must provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice, calculated as one (1) month plus two (2) weeks per year of completed service with Party A, up to a maximum of fifteen (15) months.

7.2. Termination by Party B:

Party B may terminate their employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks advance notice of their intention to resign. Party B must ensure that their resignation is not motivated by discriminatory behavior or practices experienced within the workplace. Party A is obligated to investigate and address any claims of discrimination promptly and thoroughly, fostering a fair and equitable work environment.

7.3. Mutual Obligations:

Both Party A and Party B are committed to maintaining a workplace free from discrimination. Both parties agree to report and address any incidents of discrimination promptly. Party A and Party B shall cooperate in any investigations and take appropriate corrective actions to prevent future occurrences. This commitment to a fair working environment must guide all termination decisions and processes.</input>

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Exploring the Charm of Kyoto, Then the Energy of New York City

Kyoto, Japan, is my favorite city because of its serene beauty and deep cultural roots. Walking through Kyoto feels like stepping into a living museum. Ancient temples, peaceful gardens, and traditional tea houses create a calm, reflective atmosphere. The pace of life is slower, encouraging mindfulness and appreciation of small details—like the sound of bamboo rustling or the sight of cherry blossoms falling.

Then there’s New York City, a place that pulses with energy and ambition. Skyscrapers tower over bustling streets, and every corner offers something new—street performers, food trucks, or spontaneous conversations. Unlike Kyoto’s quiet charm, New York thrives on movement and diversity. It’s a city where people chase dreams and where cultures collide in vibrant harmony.

While Kyoto offers peace and tradition, New York offers excitement and innovation. Both cities are unforgettable, but in very different ways. One soothes the soul; the other sparks the imagination.
text_b:

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Hi there! Here's a paragraph explaining which writing techniques seem most useful to me: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor and symbolism stand out as particularly useful. Metaphors allow writers to convey complex ideas and emotions through vivid comparisons, making abstract concepts more relatable and engaging for readers. Symbolism, on the other hand, imbues writing with deeper layers of meaning, enabling authors to communicate themes and messages subtly and powerfully. Free writing and focused free writing are also invaluable, as they encourage creativity and help overcome writer's block by allowing thoughts to flow freely without self-censorship. Loop writing, listing, questioning, and cubing are excellent for organizing ideas and exploring different perspectives, ensuring a comprehensive and well-rounded approach to writing. Each technique has its unique strengths, but together, they provide a robust toolkit for effective and expressive writing. Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor and symbolism stand out as particularly useful. Metaphors allow writers to convey complex ideas and emotions through vivid comparisons, making abstract concepts more relatable and engaging for readers. Symbolism, on the other hand, imbues writing with deeper layers of meaning, enabling authors to communicate themes and messages subtly and powerfully. Free writing and focused free writing are also invaluable, as they encourage creativity and help overcome writer's block by allowing thoughts to flow freely without self-censorship. Loop writing is particularly effective for refining ideas, as it involves revisiting and expanding upon initial thoughts, leading to more polished and nuanced writing. Listing helps in organizing thoughts systematically, ensuring that no important points are overlooked. Questioning is a technique that stimulates critical thinking and exploration, prompting writers to delve deeper into their topics and uncover new insights. Cubing, which involves examining a subject from multiple angles, ensures a comprehensive and well-rounded approach to writing. Each technique has its unique strengths, but together, they provide a robust toolkit for effective and expressive writing. By integrating these techniques, writers can enhance their creativity, clarity, and depth, ultimately producing more compelling and impactful work.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: One legendary creature that is popular in India is the Naga, a serpent deity reversed in Hindu and Buddhist traditions. Nagas are often depicted as half-human, half-snake beings, possessing immense power and wisdom. They are believed to reside in underground realms and water bodies, such as rivers, lakes, and oceans.

Nagas play a significant role in various myths and legends. They are considered protectors of treasures and sacred places, and are often associated with fertility and prosperity. In Hindu mythology, the Naga king Vasuki is known for his role in the churning of the ocean where he served as the rope wrapped around Mount Mandara.

In addition to their protective nature, Nagas can also be vengeful if disrespected or harmed. This duality makes them fascinating and complex figures in Indian folklore. Temples dedicated to Nagas can be found throughout India, where devotes offer prayers and rituals to seek their blessings and protection.

Prompt Level: 10.0 Prompt: Read the email from your manager. Then respond with an email that has several ideas to help her solve the budget problem. Type in the input box. Write between 80 and 100 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: Of course! Addressing a budget crisis requires a strategic approach that balances cost-cutting with maintaining essential services. Here are multiple ideas for reducing costs across different areas:

### **1. Operational Efficiency & Process Improvements**  
- **Automate processes** to reduce manual labor (e.g., digital invoicing, automated payroll).  
- **Consolidate software/licenses** (eliminate redundant tools).  
- **Negotiate better vendor contracts** (ask for discounts, switch to cheaper suppliers).  
- **Reduce energy costs** (switch to LED lighting, optimize HVAC usage).  
- **Implement remote/hybrid work** to cut office space expenses.  

### **2. Workforce & Labor Costs**  
- **Hiring freeze** (except for critical roles).  
- **Reduce overtime** by optimizing schedules.  
- **Offer voluntary unpaid leave or reduced hours**.  
- **Cross-train employees** to avoid hiring specialists.  
- **Outsource non-core functions** (e.g., IT, HR) if cheaper.  
- **Delay salary increases/bonuses** temporarily.  

### **3. Revenue Enhancement (Indirect Cost-Cutting)**  
- **Increase fees** for non-essential services.  
- **Sell underutilized assets** (equipment, property).  
- **Lease unused space** to other businesses.  
- **Apply for grants & subsidies** (government, private sector).  

### **4. Department-Specific Cuts**  
- **Marketing**: Shift to organic (free) marketing (social media, email) over paid ads.  
- **Travel**: Limit business travel, use virtual meetings.  
- **Office Supplies**: Enforce strict usage policies, go paperless.  
- **IT**: Extend hardware replacement cycles, use open-source software.  

### **5. Long-Term Structural Changes**  
- **Restructure debt** (refinance at lower interest rates).  
- **Merge departments** with overlapping functions.  
- **Conduct a zero-based budget review** (justify every expense from scratch).  

Would you like me to tailor these suggestions to a specific industry (e.g., government, nonprofit, corporate) or budget size? Let me know how I can refine these ideas for your situation!

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor and symbolism stand out as particularly useful to me. Metaphors allow for vivid and imaginative comparisons, making abstract concepts more relatable and engaging. For instance, describing time as a "thief" can evoke a strong emotional response and convey the fleeting nature of moments. This technique enriches writing by adding layers of meaning and enhancing the reader's experience.

Symbolism, on the other hand, imbues objects, characters, or events with deeper significance, often reflecting broader themes. This technique can subtly guide the reader to uncover hidden messages and insights within the text. For example, using a storm to symbolize turmoil or a rose to represent love can create powerful imagery and resonance.

Focused free writing is another valuable technique, as it encourages the flow of ideas without the constraints of structure or perfection. This method can help overcome writer's block and generate raw, authentic content that can later be refined.

Overall, these techniques—metaphor, symbolism, and focused free writing—are instrumental in crafting compelling narratives that captivate and provoke thought, making them indispensable tools in my writing arsenal.

Metaphors allow for vivid and imaginative comparisons, making abstract concepts more relatable and engaging. This technique enriches writing by adding layers of meaning and enhancing the reader's experience. Symbolism, on the other hand, imbues objects, characters, or events with deeper significance, often reflecting broader themes. This technique can subtly guide the reader to uncover hidden messages and insights within the text. For example, using a storm to symbolize turmoil or a rose to represent love can create powerful imagery and resonance. Focused free writing is another valuable technique, as it encourages the flow of ideas without the constraints of structure or perfection. This method can help overcome writer's block and generate raw, authentic content that can later be refined. Overall, these techniques—metaphor, symbolism, and focused free writing—are instrumental in crafting compelling narratives that captivate and provoke thought, making them indispensable tools in my writing arsenal.

text_b: Dear Possible Med Student, Thank you for your thoughtful question! Becoming a doctor is indeed a challenging journey, but also one of the most rewarding. Medical training is long and demanding. After completing a science-heavy undergraduate degree, you’ll face four years of medical school. The first half is mostly classroom-based, while the second half—the clinical training—places you in hospitals and clinics, where you learn hands-on under supervision. Yes, it’s tough. The hours are long, and the pressure can be intense, but the experience is invaluable. As a resident (and later, possibly a fellow), you are paid, though the salary is modest—enough to live on, but not comfortably in some cities. Still, it’s a paid opportunity to learn and grow. Career options are vast: you can specialize in surgery, pediatrics, psychiatry, dermatology, emergency medicine, and many more fields. You might work in a hospital, private clinic, community health center, or even in research or public health. Working in healthcare requires resilience, compassion, and dedication. But if you’re passionate about helping others and love learning, this career can be incredibly fulfilling. Wishing you the best on your path, —The Daily Diagnosis Resident

Prompt Level: 12.0 Prompt: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: How to Develop Leadership Qualities

I believe leadership is something we can all develop with time and effort. In my personal experience, one important quality of a good leader is responsibility. A leader needs to take responsibility not only for their own actions but also for the people they work with. I once worked on a team project at school, and our leader was someone who always supported us and made sure we all understood what to do. He didn’t blame anyone when things went wrong. Instead, he helped us find solutions. That experience showed me that patience and good communication are also very important.

Another key quality is confidence, but not arrogance. A leader should trust their decisions but also listen to others. I think kindness and respect are important too. People follow leaders they trust and respect.

In my opinion, everyone has the potential to be a leader. Some people are natural leaders, but others can learn through practice and experience. Leadership is not about being the boss; it’s about helping others and making good decisions for the group.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Review your notes and write a case report stating who was found guilty and why. Briefly comment on whether you found the verdict appropriate. Write 150-200 words. Response: Byron vs. Mr. Medina, a trespass claim. Mr. Medina broke into the Byron home during the night, damaging some of their property. Mr. Medina claims confusion. A lost young man sought refuge in an empty house. He became lost and confused in the woods that night. He saw the house, thought it was empty, and sought shelter from the night. Some of the family's personal belongings were slightly damaged. The judge ruled that entering private property without the consent of the lawful occupants with the intent to seek shelter is a criminal offense. Therefore, the judge found in favor of the Byrons. He awarded Mr. and Mrs. Byron $1,000 in damages, divided into $500 as a base amount and $500 as an extended amount, to be paid immediately by Mr. Medina. Mr. Medina must also perform 300 hours of community service because the judge ruled that the offender had violated the Byrons' trust by subjecting them to unwanted intrusion into their lives. I think this verdict is too harsh for this type of offense.

Response: Developing leadership qualities is an ongoing process that involves self-knowledge, practice and learning from experiences. Throughout my journey, I have observed and experienced some strategies that can be very effective.

One of the first lessons I learned was the importance of empathy. In a group project in college, I realized that listening to each team member's concerns and ideas not only strengthened our relationship but also led to more creative solutions. When a leader puts himself in others' shoes, he creates an environment of trust and collaboration, essential for the group's success.

Most important quality is emphaty because empathy is an extraordinary quality that brings countless benefits to both personal and professional relationships. When we are empathetic, we are able to put ourselves in someone else's shoes, understanding their emotions, challenges and perspectives. This not only strengthens bonds between people, but also creates an environment of trust and respect.

Not everyone can be a leader, you are responsible for every problem and need to be the center of a reunion

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The Monaciello is a malicious and enigmatic creature from Italian folklore, particularly associated with Naples. Its name translates to "little monk," and it is often described as a small, monk-like figure with a hooded robe. Despite its small size and modest appearance, the Monaciello is a complex figure, embodying both benevolence and malice.

According to legend, the Monaciello is a guardian spirit of treasure, living in hidden underground passages or within the walls of ancient buildings. It is said to reward those it favors with hidden riches but can also play tricks on people by moving objects, spilling liquids, or creating mysterious noises. Some believe the Monaciello to be the ghost of a benevolent monk, while others consider it a fairy-like being tied to the earth and its secrets.

The Monaciello's dual nature has made it a symbol of fortune and chaos in Neapolitan culture. Tales of its antics continue to intrigue and entertain, reflecting the region's rich tradition of blending humor and mystery in its folklore.

I’m thrilled to see so many motivated and enthusiastic faces here today as we embark on this journey together. You’re about to join a company that not only connects continents but also thrives on innovation, collaboration, and a dash of adventure.

Let me share a little about who we are. Frisko Shipping was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko, and what started as a dream has grown into a global enterprise. Today, we proudly operate in 20 cities across the world, with over 5,000 talented individuals driving our success.

Just last year, our hard work brought in a profit of 5 million dollars and secured us 10% of the global shipping market. These achievements reflect our commitment to excellence and the incredible team behind it.

Speaking of Bill, here’s an inspiring story to help you understand the spirit of Frisko Shipping. Years ago, he fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. But a passing ship saved his life—and that moment sparked the idea to create his own shipping company. It’s a testament to finding inspiration even in the most unexpected situations.

Before we dive deeper, I’d love to hear how much you already know about Frisko Shipping, so we’ll kick things off with a fun quiz.

As we move forward, I encourage each of you to bring your energy, enthusiasm, and ideas to the table. Together, let’s continue to push boundaries, connect the world, and shape the future of shipping. Thank you, and let’s get started!

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>Buying a home and applying for a home loan in my country can be both exciting and overwhelming, with various steps to navigate. The process itself tends to be challenging, especially for first-time buyers. The first major hurdle is securing a home loan, which typically requires filling out several forms, providing proof of income, and undergoing a credit check. Lenders often require detailed financial documentation, including tax returns and employment verification, which can feel tedious. Additionally, depending on the lender, the process can take weeks to months to finalize.

Housing prices in my country have risen significantly over the past few years, making it increasingly difficult to afford a home, particularly in urban areas. Many people are turning to loans to cover the high costs, but with house prices soaring, the loan amounts required are also substantial. This means monthly repayments can stretch budgets, and the overall cost of homeownership is steep.

Interest rates on home loans fluctuate based on the economy and individual lenders, but they generally range between 3-6%. While this might seem reasonable, over time, interest can significantly increase the total cost of the loan.

It’s often advisable to use a real estate agent to help navigate the housing market and find suitable properties, though it’s not mandatory. A mortgage broker can also be beneficial, especially if you’re unsure which lender offers the best terms for your financial situation. Despite the challenges, owning a home remains a major goal for many people, though it requires careful planning and consideration.</input>

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write a summary of no more than 50-60 words about the case. Use the words below. This is a non-graded activity. Response: nan
text_b: The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating. In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case. During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is becoming increasingly important in today’s business world. Companies are no longer just focused on making profits; they are also expected to make positive contributions to society and the environment. In my opinion, CSR should be seen not only as a moral obligation but also as a strategic advantage.

First, companies benefit from CSR initiatives by improving their public image. Consumers are more likely to support businesses that show a genuine commitment to social and environmental issues. For example, companies that implement sustainable practices or contribute to charitable causes can attract more loyal customers. Additionally, a strong CSR program can help with employee satisfaction, as workers tend to feel proud to be part of organizations that care about more than just profits.

However, it is important that CSR efforts are not just for show. Transparency is key, and companies should ensure their actions align with their claims. A business that promotes environmental responsibility but continues harmful practices will lose credibility. Authenticity is essential to gaining public trust.

In conclusion, while CSR can enhance a company's reputation and brand, its true value lies in making a real difference. Companies should integrate ethical practices into their core operations and ensure that their contributions are meaningful and sustainable. CSR is not just about doing good, but about doing good in a way that aligns with long-term success.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. text_b: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, I find metaphor, symbolism, and questioning to be the most useful. Metaphor allows me to convey complex ideas and emotions through vivid comparisons, making my writing more engaging and relatable. For instance, describing a challenging situation as "an uphill battle" instantly paints a clear picture of struggle and perseverance. Symbolism adds depth to my writing by embedding hidden meanings and layers of interpretation. It enriches the narrative, inviting readers to explore beyond the surface and connect with the underlying themes. Questioning is a powerful tool for generating ideas and driving the writing process forward. By asking probing questions, I can uncover new perspectives and insights, ensuring my writing remains dynamic and thought-provoking. These techniques collectively enhance my ability to communicate effectively, evoke emotions, and stimulate critical thinking in my readers. And as such I conclude this writing essay in tis poetic way. end

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Jaipur, the capital city of Rajasthan, is a place where tradition and modernity blend seamlessly. Known as the Pink City, it is renowned for its majestic palaces, vibrant bazaars, and rich cultural heritage. In contrast, Gurgaon, now officially named Gurugram, is a bustling corporate hub in Haryana, marked by its claiming skyscrapers, swanky malls, and rapid urbanization. Though both cities offer unique experiences, they have stand in stark contrast in terms of culture, lifestyle, and overall ambience.

Jaipur offer a far more immersive cultural experience than Gurgaon. The city is steeped in history, with landmarks like Hawa Mahal, Amber Fort, and City Palace narrating Tales of a regal past. The colorful markets, filled with traditional textiles, handicrafts, and jewelry, reflect the region's artistic soul. On the other hand, Gurgaon is more of a business centric city. Its Identity is defined by corporate offices, IT parks, and modern infrastructure, making it a prime destination for professionals rather than tourists.

In conclusion, while Jaipur enchants with its cultural charm and historical grandeur, Gurgaon appeals with its modernity and professional prospects. Choosing between the two ultimately depends on whether one refers the serenity of heritage or the dynamism of urban life.

In conclusion, while Jaipur enchants with its cultural charm and historical grandeur, Gurgaon appeals with its modernity and professional prospects. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The idea of celebrity culture has become increasingly toxic, and it’s hard to ignore how it often promotes a shallow, unrealistic version of success. Take, for example, the behavior of influencers or celebrities on social media who perpetuate an idealized lifestyle, often full of excess and materialism. They project an image that doesn’t reflect reality, leading followers to compare their lives with an unattainable standard. The obsession with appearance, wealth, and status is so pervasive that it drowns out more important aspects of self-worth and personal achievement. These celebrities profit from this lifestyle while encouraging a sense of inadequacy in their audience.

Worse yet, many celebrities seem out of touch with the struggles of ordinary people, using their fame to promote causes, products, or ideologies in a way that feels exploitative. The attention they receive can often lead to a distorted sense of entitlement, where their opinions are given weight regardless of their actual expertise. It’s disheartening to see how celebrity culture has become so detached from authenticity and has instead become a mechanism for profit and self-promotion, rather than something that enriches or educates society.
text_b: The idea of celebrity culture has become increasingly toxic, and it’s hard to ignore how it often promotes a shallow, unrealistic version of success. The obsession with appearance, wealth, and status is so pervasive that it drowns out more important aspects of self-worth and personal achievement. These celebrities profit from this lifestyle while encouraging a sense of inadequacy in their audience. The attention they receive can often lead to a distorted sense of entitlement, where their opinions are given weight regardless of their actual expertise. It’s disheartening to see how celebrity culture has become so detached from authenticity and has instead become a mechanism for profit and self-promotion, rather than something that enriches or educates society.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: I am delighted to share that we have successfully renewed our partnership with Crum.

We revamped our update delivery process, ensuring smoother and more efficient rollouts. This involved streamlining our deployment pipeline and incorporating automated testing to catch issues early, much like a chef perfecting their timing and technique.

Moreover, we fortified our Quality Assurance kitchen. We introduced rigorous testing protocols, including comprehensive regression testing and enhanced user acceptance testing. By fostering better communication and collaboration between our development and QA teams, we have created a more harmonious kitchen environment, ensuring that every dish we serve meets the highest standards.

These strategic changes have already borne fruit, reducing defects and enhancing overall system stability. As we continue to cook up success, we remain committed to providing robust support to prevent similar issues in the future. Our goal is to maintain the highest standards of quality and reliability for our customers.

Thank you.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: <input>When it comes to writing, we all have our own styles and preferences. For me, techniques like free writing and loop writing work wonders. They allow me to just let my thoughts flow without worrying about structure. It’s like giving my brain the freedom to think without any rules, and that often sparks creativity when I feel stuck. On the other hand, I find that listing helps me organize my thoughts, especially when I’m trying to write something more structured. It’s a great way to get my ideas out in a clear, logical format. I also love the idea of questioning, where I put myself in the reader's shoes and think about what they’d want to know. Finally, cubing is a technique that really opens up new angles, helping me explore a topic from multiple sides. Ultimately, the technique I choose depends on what I’m working on, but these methods are always helpful when I need a little nudge to get started!</input>

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Custom instruction:

ToAll
Dear Mr. Samson,

Below are the results of the surveys you requested, which were conducted in Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai.

To summarize our method: we took a sample covering all the demographics and asked how they felt about the collarless dress shirt.

If you have any queries, do not hesitate to contact me.
