James Tufnell

Head of Research

Collarless dress shirt: facts and figures

Interviewed:

Rio de Janeiro – 1000

Shanghai – 1000

Rio de Janeiro:

Approve: 35% (would buy: 20%)                  Not approve: 65%

Shanghai:

Approve: 80% (would buy: 40%)                   Not approve: 20%

For the 65% in Rio and the 20% in Shanghai, it is not a highly desirable item for several reasons:

design

size

color

material

Before launching, not enough market research carried out

Good idea, bad execution

Moving forward, this is what we should consider:

More research: what men want and need in an accessory

Design: more attention to detail, e.g. stitching color

Size: slim fitting

Colors: strong primary colors; black and white

Material: wrinkle-free and/or sweat absorbent

Changes for Rio are a priority, because Asia results are satisfactory

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Metaphor and hyperbole have both been incredibly useful to me in enhancing the way I express thoughts and emotions. Metaphors allow me to draw comparisons between seemingly unrelated things, making abstract ideas more relatable and vivid. For example, when I describe anxiety as a “storm in my chest,” it paints a clearer picture of the emotional turmoil I feel, allowing others to better understand my experience. Metaphors also help bring creativity and depth to my writing, making it more engaging and meaningful. On the other hand, hyperbole, or deliberate exaggeration, has helped me emphasize strong feelings or situations in a dramatic and memorable way. Saying “I’ve told you a million times” might not be literally true, but it powerfully conveys frustration or impatience. Hyperbole grabs attention and often adds humor or intensity to what I’m communicating. Together, these techniques have improved both my spoken and written communication, helping me to express myself more clearly, connect with others emotionally, and leave a lasting impression.

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: • Incentivize your employees. Make them feel that the company's success means success for them as well. There's nothing like a possible reward to motivate people. A program like this will probably have to come from upper management, not just from the direct manager. • Take an active interest in your employees' career paths. Offer them additional training, and act as their mentor. If employees feel that a brighter future is ahead, it will motivate them. • Emphasize a healthy work-life balance. One way to do this is to make sure everyone takes their vacation time. Refreshed people are motivated people. • Listening is key. If people feel that their manager is listening to them, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive. Listen to your employees! • Above all of this is one general idea: Respect for others goes a long way toward motivating people. Treat subordinates the way you would like to be treated by your superiors. But what can you do to demotivate your staff? How can you be a bad manager? • Use your managerial position to show people who's boss. Disrespect subordinates because they are below you. • Take credit or claim responsibility for work done by your subordinates. They work for you, right? So why give them credit? • Lose your temper. Getting angry always shows people who's boss! • Let employees unfairly take the blame for things. Better them than you, right? • Don't compliment or praise people for good work. The next thing you know, they'll want a promotion or pay raise! Motivating people takes much more work than demotivating them, but if you follow the tips above, you can build a solid, productive team!

Best,
A Resident Doctor</input>

text_b: An airplane is made up of several essential parts that work together to ensure a comfortable and safe flight. The main components of an airplane include the fuselage, which is the main body of the aircraft, wings, empennagewhich consists of the tail and stabilizing surfaces, landing gear, engines, and control surfaces such as ailerons, elevators, and rudders. Each part is crucial to the aircraft's ability to fly, maneuver, and land safely. The wings provide lift and stability during the flight, the engines generate thrust power to propel the airplane during takeoff, the empennage helps with stability and control, and the landing gear allows for safe takeoff and landing. All these parts are carefully designed and engineered with precision and expertise to ensure the safety and performance of the aircraft. In addition, many other components, such as radar, hydraulics, and electrical systems, are essential for the aircraft's operation and safety.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write a report about a collision between your vessel and a right whale. Use your own ideas. Write 100-150 words. Type in the input box. Response: Marine Incident Report: Vessel-Whale Collision
Vessel Name: MV Horizon Star
Date of Incident: 18 June 2025
Time of Incident: 0330 hrs (local time)
Location: Approx. 42°15'N, 66°20'W — Northwest Atlantic Ocean
Weather Conditions: Overcast, sea state 4, moderate visibility
Species Involved: North Atlantic Right Whale (Eubalaena glacialis)
Summary:
At approximately 0330 hours, while transiting northbound at 12 knots, MV Horizon Star experienced an unexpected impact along the starboard bow. The vessel was operating under normal watch procedures, using radar, AIS, and forward-looking sonar. Upon inspection, and confirmation via deck camera playback, the object struck was identified as a North Atlantic Right Whale, an endangered species.
Actions Taken:
- Reduced speed immediately to 5 knots and initiated evasive maneuvers.
- Alerted bridge officers and logged coordinates.
- Notified marine authorities per MARPOL and NOAA guidelines.
- Conducted hull integrity check — no structural damage detected.
- Crew visually monitored area; no additional sightings occurred post-impact.
- Submitted formal report to Marine Mammal Stranding Network and relevant environmental agencies.
Impact:
Condition of the whale could not be assessed post-collision due to night conditions and moderate sea state. The incident is under review to determine contributing factors and to evaluate if further mitigations are required.
Preventive Measures:
- Enhanced lookout protocols in known whale migratory corridors.
- Route adjustment under consideration to avoid high-density zones.
- Reinforcement of bridge crew training on whale detection and response.
Filed by:
Chief Officer Lucas Mendes

Take, for example, the endless parade of social media influencers who, by simply posting curated photos or engaging in controversial behavior, achieve millions of followers and, consequently, a platform from which they can promote consumerism, body standards, and lifestyles that are far removed from the reality most people face. What is frustrating is the lack of meaningful contribution to society that many celebrities offer. While there are certainly exceptions, the overwhelming majority spend their time indulging in luxury and self-promotion, with little regard for the issues affecting the world. This reinforces the dangerous idea that fame and wealth are to be admired above all else, diverting attention away from more pressing concerns like education, mental health, and environmental degradation. In short, the elevation of celebrities can often feel like a reflection of society's misplaced priorities.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is an important topic in today's business world. The debate is about how companies should care about society's welfare as well as making profits, or if they should focus only on making money for their shareholders. 

Supporters of CSR say that companies have a big impact on the communities where they operate. By adopting sustainable practices and offering fair benefits to employees, companies not only secure their future but also help society. For example, companies with strong CSR initiatives often enjoy greater customer loyalty, which leads to better financial performance. This relationship between busines and society shows the importance of CSR in creating a positive corporate image.

However, critics of CSR argue that the main responsibility of a business is to its shareholders. They say that the resources spent on CSR could be better used in activities that directly increase profits. Additionally, some believe that CSR initiatives are often superficial, serving more as marketing tools than genuine efforts to make a difference. 

Despite these criticisms, the benefits of CSR cannot be ignored. While it is true that businesses must remain profitable, integrating CSR into their core strateges can lead to sustainable growth. Companies that ignore social expectations risk damaging their reputation and losing consumer trust. Moreover, CSR initiatives can drive innovation and open new markets, benefiting both the company and society.
text_b: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is an important topic in today's business world. The debate is about how companies should care about society's welfare as well as making profits, or if they should focus only on making money for their shareholders. Supporters of CSR say that companies have a big impact on the communities where they operate. By adopting sustainable practices and offering fair benefits to employees, companies not only secure their future but also help society. For example, companies with strong CSR initiatives often enjoy greater customer loyalty, which leads to better financial performance. This relationship between busines and society shows the importance of CSR in creating a positive corporate image. However, critics of CSR argue that the main responsibility of a business is to its shareholders. They say that the resources spent on CSR could be better used in activities that directly increase profits. Additionally, some believe that CSR initiatives are often superficial, serving more as marketing tools than genuine efforts to make a difference. Despite these criticisms, the benefits of CSR cannot be ignored. While it is true that businesses must remain profitable, integrating CSR into their core strateges can lead to sustainable growth. Companies that ignore social expectations risk damaging their reputation and losing consumer trust. Moreover, CSR initiatives can drive innovation and open new markets, benefiting both the company and society.

Improved Quality Assurance Processes: We have enhanced our Quality Assurance (QA) procedures, including more thorough testing and better pre-release checks. By adopting more stringent QA standards, we ensure that any potential issues are identified and fixed before they reach Crum. Closing: Future: Moving forward, we are fully committed to providing ongoing support to prevent any future problems that could affect Crum’s customers. By continuously refining our processes and maintaining open communication, we aim to ensure smooth, uninterrupted service and uphold the quality that Crum values in our partnership.
